...after transmitting data. And you should be able to manually open them after transmitting.

That is all.

Why not auto-retract?

Also, as far as I know you can manually extend them by right clicking.

> 
> Why not auto-retract?
> Also, as far as I know you can manually extend them by right clicking.

I thought that only happened if you're using Remote Tech ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

Agreed, that's been driving me crazy since I bought the game. The problem is, before they've transmitted any data you can right-click to extend or retract them, *but that option vanishes after the first time they transmit!* And since they auto-retract after transmission, they're then permanently stuck in the retracted position (except when transmitting again). It's not a huge issue, mostly cosmetic, but extremely annoying. And it's not a mod causing it, it still behaves so even in a 100% stock install.

> 
> Why not auto-retract?
> Also, as far as I know you can manually extend them by right clicking.

Indeed you can but that's not what tg626 is talking about. After transmitting science antennae close and stay closed. They can no longer be opened by right clicking.

This is an old issue that at one point was fixed but was reintroduced one or two updates later. Best thing to do is assign an action group to toggle antennae. Once closed by science they still respond to action groups

It's not a huge issue, mostly cosmetic, but extremely annoying. And it's not a mod causing it, it still behaves so even in a 100% stock install.

Put 'toggle" on a hotkey. Works even after you lose the ability to extend it via right click.

This can be difficult when you have a multi-antenna array (to look good) because its hard to tell which antenna will respond to science (not to mention symmetry and what not). One solution is to have "Extend", "Retract", and "Toggle". (but thats a discussion for after this gets put in suggestions & bug reports)

Glad to see antennae enthusiasts out there.

I like antennae, and I like them extended. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

As for multi-antenna setups the best one is always used for transmissions. 

If all antennae are the same, well it seems to be kinda random. Or at least I didn't see any logic in it.

Assigning all of them to the same action group (toggle) does the trick. 

> 
>  So, you have all of them extended. You transmit, one of them folds and gets stuck.
> 
> Then you hit your action button, the rest of them fold. Press it again - all your antennae are up and erect again.

I just tried it too, with different results.

probe, battery, thermometer, launch clamp, the 3 antennae set to toggle on action group 1

cycled the action group a few times, it works. Temp reading, transmit, game chooses communotron-88. It finishes and closes.

action group 1 pressed, nothing happens. Action group 1 pressed again resulting in the communotron-88 reopening, the communotron-16 and the DTS or whatever the middle one is called both closed!

I have the full right click control over the 2 antenna that were used to transmit, and only action group control over the one that did transmit. Its easy enough to set the other two back to match the action group controlled antenna.

> 
> As for multi-antenna setups the best one is always used for transmissions. 
> 
>  If all antennae are the same, well it seems to be kinda random. Or at least I didn't see any logic in it.

Knowing how some things are coded, I'd say it's likely along the lines of "The first one placed on the antenna bearing part closest to the craft root", since the game's craft function logic radiates outward from the root of a craft in a depth-first search, and when things are in the same node of the tree they tend to be simple lists ordered by placement.
